events.message: The insured reported a car accident that occurred last night involving a collision with another vehicle at a traffic intersection.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on description mentioning vehicle collision and damage sustained.
An insurance agent was promptly assigned to the case to provide assistance and gather additional information about the car accident.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and reassured the customer that the evaluation process will begin shortly.
The agent requested necessary documents including the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates.
Customer submitted all requested documents promptly, including the official accident report and multiple photographs showing vehicle damage.
The claims department has started investigation of the vehicle collision to verify the circumstances and liability details.
Investigation concluded with determination that the insured was not at fault; all submitted evidence was reviewed carefully.
Insurer proposed a settlement offer covering the repair costs and related expenses based on the evaluation of the accident claim.
Customer responded positively upon receiving the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the timely claim handling.
Based on documentation and investigation, the claim was officially approved for full coverage of damages sustained during the auto accident.
The settlement amount was disbursed to the customerâ€™s bank account to cover vehicle repairs and related expenses.
The claim was closed successfully after payment issuance and confirmation that the repair process has started.
All records related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference and compliance documentation.
